t: Proverbs 11
Contrast the Upright and the Wicked
A*pn false balance is an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ln a just weight is His delight.
When*ln pride comes, then comes dishonor, But*ln with the humble is wisdom.
The*ln integrity of the upright will guide them, But*ln the crookedness of the treacherous will destroy them.
Riches*ln do not profit in the day of wrath, But*ln righteousness delivers from death.
The*ln righteousness of the blameless will smooth his way, But*ln the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
The*ln righteousness of the upright will deliver them, But*ln the treacherous will be caught by their*i own*i greed.
When*ln a wicked man dies, his*i expectation will perish, And*ln the hope of strong men perishes.
The*ln righteous is delivered from trouble, But*ln the wicked takes his place.
With*ln his*i mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor, But*ln through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.
When*ln it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices, And*ln when the wicked perish, there is joyful shouting.
By*ln the blessing of the upright a city is exalted, But*ln by the mouth of the wicked it is torn down.
He*ln who despises his neighbor lacks sense, But*ln a man of understanding keeps silent.
He*ln who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets, But*ln he who is trustworthy conceals a matter.
Where*ln there is no guidance the people fall, But*ln in abundance of counselors there is victory.
He*ln who is guarantor for a stranger will surely suffer for it, But*ln he who hates being a guarantor is secure.
A*ln gracious woman attains honor, And*ln ruthless men attain riches.
The*ln merciful man does himself good, But*ln the cruel man does himself harm.
The*ln wicked earns deceptive wages, But*ln he who sows righteousness gets*i a true reward.
He*ln who is steadfast in righteousness will*i attain*i to life, And*ln he who pursues evil will*i bring*i about*i his own death.
The*ln perverse in heart are an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ln the blameless in their*i walk are His delight.
Assuredly,*ln the evil man will not go unpunished, But*ln the descendants of the righteous will be delivered.
As*iln a ring of gold in a swineâ€™s snout So*iln is*i a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.
The*ln desire of the righteous is only good, But*iln the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
There*ln is one who scatters, and yet*i increases all the more, And*ln there is one who withholds what is justly due, and*i yet*i it*i results*i only in want.
The*ln generous man will be prosperous, And*ln he who waters will himself be watered.

He*ln who diligently seeks good seeks favor, But*ln he who seeks evil, evil will come to him.
He*ln who trusts in his riches will fall, But*ln the righteous will flourish like the green*i leaf.

The*ln fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And*ln he who is wise wins souls.
If*ln the righteous will be rewarded in the earth, How*ln much more the wicked and the sinner!
